titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE Sir Fulke Greuille, Knight; Chancelour of the Exchequer, one of his Maiesties most Ho∣nourable Priuie Coun∣sailours; A most wise, learned, iudicious, inge∣nuous Censor of Schollership; a worthy example of Benefactors to Learning, I. H.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE Sir Fulke Greuille, Knight; Chancelour of the Exchequer, one of his Maiesties most Ho∣nourable Priuie Coun∣sailours; A most wise, learned, iudicious, inge∣nuous Censor of Schollership; a worthy example of Benefactors to Learning, I. H.

monogr.title: Contemplations vpon the principal passages of the holie historie. The third volume: in three bookes. By I. Hall, Doctor of Diuinitie
monogr.author: Hall, Joseph

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE Sir Fulke Greuille, Knight; Chancelour of the Exchequer, one of his Maiesties most Honourable Priuie Counsailours; A most wise, learned, iudicious, ingenuous Censor of Schollership; a worthy example of Benefactors to Learning, I. H.

p.hi: With his vnfained prayers for the happie successe of all his honourable designements, humbly Dedicates this meane peece of his studies.
